canonical_explanation.text: Everything around us can be divided into two groups: living things and non-living things. Living things like plants, animals, and people need food and water, breathe air, grow and change, move on their own, and can have babies. Non-living things like stones, toys, and chairs do not eat, breathe, grow, move by themselves, or have babies. We can look at these features to decide if something is living or non-living.
rules: Living things need food and water to survive.
Living things grow and change over time.
Living things can move on their own.
Living things can reproduce (have babies or make new plants).
Non-living things do not have any of these features.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a living thing?
questions.explanation_correct: A cow is a living thing because it eats food, drinks water, breathes air, grows bigger, moves on its own, and can have baby calves.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rock, table, and ball are non-living things. They cannot eat, breathe, grow, or have babies. A cow is the correct answer because it does all these things.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a non-living thing?
questions.explanation_correct: A chair is a non-living thing. It cannot eat, breathe, grow, or have babies. It does not need food or water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A dog, tree, and fish are all living things. They need food and water, they breathe, and they can grow. A chair is made of wood or plastic and is non-living.

questions.question_text: Living things need ___ to survive.
questions.explanation_correct: Living things like plants and animals need food and water to survive. These give them energy to grow and stay healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Living things do not need toys, paint, or rocks to survive. They need food and water to live, grow, and have energy.

questions.question_text: Which of these can grow?
questions.explanation_correct: A kitten can grow because it is a living thing. It will grow bigger and become a cat over time.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A shoe, pencil, and toy car are non-living things. They cannot grow or change on their own. Only living things like kittens can grow bigger.

questions.question_text: Non-living things:
questions.explanation_correct: Non-living things like stones, chairs, and toys do not grow. They stay the same size forever.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Non-living things do not need food, do not breathe air, and cannot have babies. These are all things that only living things can do. Non-living things do not grow.

questions.question_text: Which of these breathes?
questions.explanation_correct: A parrot breathes because it is a living thing. All living things need air to stay alive.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A stone, spoon, and bottle are non-living things. They do not need to breathe. Only the parrot, a living bird, needs air to live.

questions.question_text: A mango tree is a ___ thing.
questions.explanation_correct: A mango tree is a living thing. It needs water and sunlight, it grows tall, and it gives us mangoes with seeds to make new trees.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A mango tree is not non-living, a toy, or made of metal. It is a living plant that grows, needs water and air, and can make new plants.

questions.question_text: A glass is a ___ thing.
questions.explanation_correct: A glass is a non-living thing. It cannot eat, breathe, grow, or have babies. It just stays the same.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A glass is not living, growing, or breathing. It is made by people and does not need food or water. It is a non-living thing.

questions.question_text: Which living thing can move from place to place?
questions.explanation_correct: A butterfly can fly from place to place on its own. It is a living thing that moves freely.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A rose bush, sunflower, and grass are living things too, but they stay in one spot because they are rooted in the ground. A butterfly can move around freely.

questions.question_text: Which of these can have babies?
questions.explanation_correct: A hen can have babies called chicks. It lays eggs that hatch into baby chicks. Only living things can have babies.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A chair, glass, and clock are non-living things. They cannot lay eggs or have babies. Only living things like hens can have babies.

questions.question_text: An ant is a ___ thing.
questions.explanation_correct: An ant is a living thing. It can move, eat food, breathe, and have baby ants. Even though it is tiny, it is alive!
questions.explanation_incorrect: An ant is not non-living, plastic, or metal. It is a small insect that is alive. It can walk, carry food, and live in a group with other ants.

questions.question_text: Which of these does NOT need food?
questions.explanation_correct: A book is a non-living thing. It does not need food or water. Only living things like cats, goats, and birds need food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A cat, goat, and bird are all living things that need food to stay alive and healthy. A book is made of paper and is non-living, so it does not need food.

questions.question_text: A bicycle is:

options.text: Non-living because it cannot eat, grow, or breathe

questions.explanation_correct: A bicycle is non-living because it cannot eat, grow, or breathe on its own. Someone has to ride it to make it move.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Even though a bicycle moves, it is not living. It needs a person to push the pedals. Living things move on their own and also eat, grow, and breathe.

questions.question_text: A tulsi plant is:
questions.explanation_correct: A tulsi plant is living because it needs water and sunlight, it grows bigger, and it can make new seeds to grow more tulsi plants.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A tulsi plant is not non-living, a toy, or made of plastic. It is a real plant that grows in gardens and homes in India. It needs care, water, and sunlight to stay alive.

questions.question_text: Which of these does NOT need water?
questions.explanation_correct: A watch is a non-living thing. It does not need water. Only living things like fish, plants, and cows need water to survive.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Fish, plants, and cows are all living things that need water. A watch is made of metal and glass and is non-living, so it does not need water.

questions.question_text: Living things can ___ over time.
questions.explanation_correct: Living things grow bigger over time. A baby grows into a child, a seed grows into a plant, and a puppy grows into a dog.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Living things do not stay the same size always, turn into metal, or become toys. They grow bigger and change as they get older.

questions.question_text: Which of these is living?
questions.explanation_correct: A squirrel is a living thing because it can move, eat nuts, breathe, grow, and have baby squirrels.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A wooden doll, plastic flower, and toy bear are all made by people. They are non-living things. A squirrel is a real animal that is alive.

questions.question_text: A river has fish in it. The fish are ___ things and the water is a ___ thing.
questions.explanation_correct: Fish are living things because they eat, breathe, grow, and have babies. Water is a non-living thing because it does not eat, breathe, or grow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Fish can swim, eat, and have babies, so they are living. Water does not eat, grow, or breathe, so it is non-living. The correct pair is living and non-living.

questions.question_text: A seed is a ___ thing.
questions.explanation_correct: A seed is a living thing. When you give it water and sunlight, it can grow into a new plant. It has life inside it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A seed may look small and quiet, but it is alive. When planted in soil with water and sunlight, it grows into a plant. So it is living, not non-living.

questions.question_text: A toy robot can walk. Is it living or non-living?

options.text: Non-living because it cannot eat, grow, or breathe

questions.explanation_correct: A toy robot is non-living because it cannot eat, grow, or breathe on its own. It needs batteries to move and cannot have babies.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Even though a toy robot can walk, it is still non-living. It needs batteries to work. Living things move on their own and also need food, water, and air.

questions.question_text: Priya waters her plant every day. Why does the plant need water?

options.text: Because it is a living thing and needs water to survive

questions.explanation_correct: The plant is living and needs water to survive and grow. Without water, the plant would dry up and die.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The plant does not need water just to look pretty or to make the pot heavy. It needs water because it is alive and all living things need water to survive.

questions.question_text: A puppy grows into a dog. What does this tell us about a puppy?
questions.explanation_correct: A puppy grows into a dog. This shows it is a living thing because only living things can grow and change over time.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A puppy is not non-living, plastic, or a toy. It grows bigger, eats food, and breathes air. Growing is a sign of being alive.

questions.question_text: Why does a stone never grow bigger?

options.text: Because it is a non-living thing

questions.explanation_correct: A stone never grows bigger because it is a non-living thing. Only living things like plants and animals can grow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The stone does not grow because it is non-living. Being small, hard, or grey has nothing to do with it. Non-living things cannot grow.

questions.question_text: A hen lays eggs that hatch into chicks. This shows the hen is:
questions.explanation_correct: A hen is living because it can lay eggs and have baby chicks. Having babies is something only living things can do.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A hen is not non-living, wooden, or a toy. It lays eggs, eats grain, and breathes air. These show it is a living thing.

questions.question_text: Aman forgot to water his tulsi plant for many days. The plant dried up. Why?

options.text: The plant is living and needs water to survive

questions.explanation_correct: The tulsi plant dried up because it is a living thing that needs water to survive. Without water, living things cannot stay healthy.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants are not angry. The plant dried up because it did not get water. Living things need water, food, and air to stay alive.

questions.question_text: Rina has a goldfish and a toy fish. Which one needs food?
questions.explanation_correct: Only the goldfish needs food because it is a living thing. The toy fish is non-living and does not need food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The toy fish is not alive, so it does not need food. The goldfish is a real living fish that needs food and water to survive.

questions.question_text: A frog can jump and a ball can bounce. Which one is living?
questions.explanation_correct: The frog is living because it jumps on its own, eats insects, and breathes air. The ball only bounces when someone throws it.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The ball is not living. It moves only when someone throws it. The frog can jump by itself because it is a living animal.

questions.question_text: Which of these is living?
questions.explanation_correct: A caterpillar is a living thing. It eats leaves, grows bigger, and changes into a butterfly. It is alive!
questions.explanation_incorrect: A paper boat, plastic cup, and rubber band are all made by people. They are non-living. A caterpillar is a real insect that is alive.

questions.question_text: Why do animals need food?

options.text: To get energy and stay alive

questions.explanation_correct: Animals need food to get energy. This energy helps them move, grow, and stay healthy and alive.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Animals do not eat food to look nice, play with it, or paint with it. They eat food because it gives them energy to live, grow, and move.

questions.question_text: Can a table eat food?

options.text: Yes, when we put food on it
No, because it is too hard

questions.explanation_correct: A table is a non-living thing. It cannot eat food. Only living things like animals and people can eat.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Putting food on a table does not mean the table eats. A table is non-living and cannot eat, drink, or do anything on its own.

questions.question_text: A fish lives in water but a toy boat also floats in water. How are they different?

options.text: The fish is living and the boat is non-living
The boat is living and the fish is non-living

questions.explanation_correct: The fish is a living thing that swims, eats, and breathes in water. The toy boat is non-living and just floats because of its shape.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The fish and the toy boat are very different. The fish is alive and can swim, eat, and breathe. The boat is just a toy made by people.

questions.question_text: Ravi saw a snail moving slowly. His friend said snails are non-living because they are slow. Is his friend right?

options.text: No, the snail is living because it moves, eats, and grows
Yes, snails are made of stone

questions.explanation_correct: The friend is wrong. A snail is living even though it is slow. It can move, eat food, grow, and have babies. Speed does not decide if something is living.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Being slow does not make something non-living. Snails are living animals that eat, breathe, grow, and have babies, even if they move slowly.

questions.question_text: A plant cannot walk. Then why is it called living?

options.text: Because it can grow, breathe, and make new plants
Because it stays in the garden

questions.explanation_correct: A plant is living because it can grow, breathe, and make new plants from seeds. Walking is not needed to be living.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Being green, tall, or staying in a garden does not make something living. Plants are living because they grow, breathe, and make new plants.

questions.question_text: Which feature is found in BOTH a dog and a neem tree?
questions.explanation_correct: Both a dog and a neem tree need water to live. They are both living things that need water, air, and food to survive and grow.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dogs can run and bark, but neem trees cannot. Neem trees do not have legs either. The one thing they both need is water, because they are both living things.

questions.question_text: A seed grows into a plant. A marble stays the same size. What is the difference?

options.text: The seed is living, the marble is non-living

questions.explanation_correct: The seed is living, so it can grow into a plant. The marble is non-living, so it always stays the same size.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Size and colour are not the reason. The real difference is that the seed is alive and can grow, while the marble is non-living and cannot change on its own.

questions.question_text: All living things move from place to place. Is this statement true?

options.text: No, plants are living but they do not move from place to place
Yes, only moving things are living

questions.explanation_correct: Not all living things move from place to place. Plants are living things but they stay in one place because their roots hold them in the ground.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Plants cannot walk or move to a new place, but they are still living. They grow, breathe, and make new plants. So the statement is false.

questions.question_text: A car moves but it is non-living because it cannot grow or breathe. Is this correct?

options.text: No, a car is living because it moves
Yes, a car is non-living because it cannot grow, eat, or breathe
No, a car is living because it makes sounds
Yes, a car is non-living because it is heavy

questions.explanation_correct: Yes, a car is non-living. Even though it moves, it cannot grow, eat, or breathe like living things. It needs petrol and a driver to work.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Moving or making sounds does not make something living. A car needs fuel and a person to run it. It cannot eat, grow, or breathe, so it is non-living.

questions.question_text: Sita says that a cloud is living because it moves in the sky. Is Sita right?

options.text: Yes, clouds are living because they move
No, clouds are non-living because they do not eat, grow, or have babies
Yes, clouds are living because they give rain
No, clouds are living but they fly

questions.explanation_correct: Sita is not right. Clouds move because wind pushes them, not on their own. Clouds cannot eat, grow, or have babies, so they are non-living.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Just because something moves does not make it living. Clouds move because of wind. They do not eat food, breathe, grow, or have babies. So they are non-living.

questions.question_text: Which group has ONLY living things?
questions.explanation_correct: Dog, parrot, and mango tree are all living things. They eat, breathe, grow, and can have babies.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option A has a ball (non-living). Option C has a stone (non-living). Option D has all non-living things. Only option B has all living things.

questions.question_text: Which group has ONLY non-living things?
questions.explanation_correct: Chair, table, and fan are all non-living things. They cannot eat, breathe, grow, or have babies.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Option B has all living things. Options C and D mix living and non-living things. Only option A has all non-living things.

questions.question_text: Name two things that BOTH living and non-living things can do.

options.text: Move and grow on their own

questions.explanation_correct: Both living and non-living things can be seen and touched. You can see and touch a dog and also see and touch a rock. But only living things can eat, grow, and breathe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eating, breathing, growing, and having babies are things only living things can do. Both living and non-living things can be seen and touched.

questions.question_text: A dog is a living thing.
questions.explanation_correct: A dog is a living thing because it eats food, drinks water, breathes air, grows, moves, and can have baby puppies.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A dog is not a non-living thing. It eats, breathes, grows, and can have babies. All these show it is alive.

questions.question_text: A stone can grow bigger.
questions.explanation_correct: A stone cannot grow bigger because it is a non-living thing. Only living things can grow and change.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Stones are non-living. They do not eat or drink, so they cannot grow. They always stay the same size.

questions.question_text: Plants need water to live.
questions.explanation_correct: Plants are living things and they need water to stay alive and grow. Without water, a plant will dry up and die.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Plants need water to survive. If you do not water a plant, it will become dry and will not stay healthy.

questions.question_text: A pencil can breathe.
questions.explanation_correct: A pencil cannot breathe because it is a non-living thing. Only living things like animals and plants can breathe air.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A pencil is made of wood and graphite. It is not alive. It does not have lungs or any way to take in air.

questions.question_text: Animals can have babies, but toys cannot.
questions.explanation_correct: This is true. Animals are living things and they can have babies. Toys are non-living things and they cannot have babies.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Animals are alive and can have babies. Toys are made by people and are not alive, so they cannot have babies.

questions.question_text: A flower is a non-living thing.
questions.explanation_correct: A flower is a living thing. It is a part of a plant. It grows, needs water, and helps make seeds for new plants.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A flower is not non-living. It is part of a living plant. Flowers grow, use water, and help plants make seeds.

questions.question_text: Non-living things do not need food.
questions.explanation_correct: Non-living things like rocks, books, and chairs do not need food. They do not need energy to exist because they are not alive.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Non-living things never need to eat because they do not use energy to live, move, or grow.

questions.question_text: A bird is a non-living thing.
questions.explanation_correct: A bird is a living thing. It can fly, eat insects and seeds, breathe air, and have baby birds.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A bird is not non-living. Birds can move, eat, breathe, and have babies. All these show that a bird is alive.

questions.question_text: All living things can move from place to place.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. Plants are living things but they do not move from place to place. They stay fixed in the ground because of their roots.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Not all living things walk or fly. Plants are living but they stay in one place. So this statement is false.
